case_vignette: A 55-year-old man presents to the emergency department after a motor vehicle collision. The patient has a Glasgow coma scale of 7 and is immediately intubated. He has a past medical history of hypertension, diabetes, and acute coronary syndrome. His temperature is 97.9°F (36.6°C), blood pressure is 174/114 mmHg, and pulse is 50/min. Physical exam is notable for a man who is currently intubated and sedated. He has multiple bruises and a hematoma over his scalp. An ECG is performed as seen in Figure A.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?
